name: ajaxproxy
description: Creates a JavaScript proxy for a ColdFusion component, for use in an AJAX client. Alternatively, creates a proxy for a single CFC method, JavaScript function, or URL that is bound to one or more control attribute values.

params.name: bind
params.description: **(not supported)** A bind expression that specifies a CFC method, JavaScript function, or URL to call. Cannot be used with the cfc attribute.

params.name: cfc
params.description:
the CFC for which to create a proxy. You must specify a dot-delimited path to the CFC. The path can be absolute or relative to location of the CFML page. For example, if the myCFC CFC is in the cfcs subdirectory of the Luceex page, specify cfcs.myCFC.

On UNIX based systems, the tag searches first for a file whose name or path corresponds to the specified name or path, but is in all lower case. If it does not find it, Luceex then searches for a file name or path that corresponds to the attribute value exactly, with identical character casing.

params.name: jsclassname
params.description: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class.

params.name: onerror
params.description: The name of a JavaScript function to invoke when a bind, specified by the bind attribute fails. The function must take two arguments: an error code and an error message.

params.name: onsuccess
params.description: The name of a JavaScript function to invoke when a bind, specified by the bind attribute succeeds. The function must take one argument, the bind function return value. If the bind function is a CFC function, the return value is automatically converted to a JavaScript variable before being passed to the onSuccess function.
